# Welcome! {.unnumbered}

Biodiverse is a free tool for the spatial analysis of diversity using indices based on taxonomic, phylogenetic, matrix and trait-based relationships. This book is made to support to new users of Biodiverse, introducing the main features of the software. It contains walk-through tutorials, explanations of key concepts and other resources to support your diversity analysis.

![](images/biodiverse-book-cover.png){width=60% fig-align="center"}

This book is built using [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/) and hosted via GitHub Pages, it is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/).

### Got a question?

Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have question or feedback about the software.
We encourage you to start a [GitHub Discussion](https://github.com/shawnlaffan/biodiverse/discussions) so we can help! 

Alternatively, you can post your question at our [Google Group Forum](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/biodiverse-users). We recommend searching through past conversations to see if your question has been raised by others. 

### How to contribute

Biodiverse is an open source tool. While it is actively maintained, our capacity is limited. We welcome contributions that can improve the usage and understanding  of Biodiverse.

There are many ways to contribute:

- Fixing grammar and typos in documentation
- Clarification or expanding on existing documentation
- Refining exisitng features
- Adding new features to the software
- Testing out new features

Submit your ideas in our [GitHub Discussions board](https://github.com/shawnlaffan/biodiverse/discussions)
